page.title: 10Old and New Houses
page.content:
In our survey district the houses are a mixture of old and new. The older houses in the area are mainly built in the Cotswalds style. The village of Colerne has doubled in size over the last forty years.
We have looked at the oldest and the newest houses in the village.The oldest house is called Daubeneys it was built around 1260 and New College Oxford may have restored it in the 1600's . It was originally a longhouse, the family lived at one end and the animals lived at the other this way of living had a purpose the animals body_heat would rise and act as central heating. The main framework of the house was built with large oak crooks. Outside the house is built of stone and the roof is covered in stone tiles.
